Review Text:
We are a group of friends who love to visit star restaurants regularly.Arriving at the hotel we were kind of disturbed that only french was spoken…we are Dutch, German and American…we tried our best to get some information about the hotel.. not easy and we do expect in that level of a hotel that at least some other language is spoken.
Regarding the restaurant…the amouse bouche..the starters…the visit in the kitchen ..superb..and luckily..here the language was NO problem at all..except the sommelier who we could not really understand
The food was delicious till one of us got a langustino which still had the intestine in it….that is really not nice. When we complained, the reaction was simply…oh yeah…no..I am sorry…or can I bring you a new one …we do expect more
Would we recommend the restaurant…actually no….

Review Title: No words will be good enough to described L’air Du Temps.
Review Text:
Disclaimer: no words will be good enough to described L’air Du Temps.

The food was perfect.  The environment was top.  You start your culinary journey in a little salon, swing by the kitchen (were they actually make a little dish for you which you eat in the kitchen), and “end” in their dinning room. You have a marvelous view on the fields around the restaurant and sit in a room that is some quite that it made me over-emotional (I was actually crying when sitting at my table, my emotions went in all direction, I never had such an experience).

If I can make 2 remarks 😊
•	Why only 2 stars in Michelin?  They should have 3 stars! 
•	They are located in the French speaking part of Belgium.  I was MEGA surprised that everyone spoke Dutch (not perfectly but more than I would expect in Namur).  Just make sure that when you translate the menu from French to Dutch that you have it checked by someone that understand Dutch very well, and Google Translate is not always the best translator 😉 

Oh and did I already say that I LOVED IT!

Breathtaking dinner and stay at the hotel. Incredible food, service (both during the meal and my hotel stay) held to an exceptional standard, and what an unforgettable setting. I can’t wait to return with more of my family. Thank you!
Excellent experience, end-to-end! One of the most creative and innovative chefs in Belgium, fabulous sommelier and extremely professional staff. Count apprx 350€ pp, but it’s worth every cent!

Absolutely fabulous: imaginative dishes, supremely tasty accompanied by a great wine selection by the sommelier and also fantastic service, a whirlwind of professionalism and courtesy.
The rooms are pretty nice as well.
A fantastic place for a special occasion.

Overall=10/10

A marvelous experience..Had a great dinner & night here. Dining room of the restaurant is amazing, with a nice view of the lovely surroundings!!! My partner and I enjoyed the food that we never had before. So Far the experience was lit!!

Had a great dinner & night here. Dining room of the restaurant is amazing, with a nice view on the garden. Food was lovely with some asian influences in every dish. Very vegetable oriented menu with some fish and few meat, which was ok for us but something to keep in mind when booking. Good to add is that of all michelin star restaurants we attended, we thought the wine pairing was by far the best we’ve seen. Amazing. Room we stayed in was ok, breakfast again very good.

All in all an expensive night, but would really recommend

A marvellous expérience , for our 20th mariage anniversary .
One of our relationship suggested us not to take the wines but the water’s, a good suggestion because it does not alter rates the délicatesse of the different dishes you will have the chance to taste ...
The price is high but the experience is at that price we believe...
If you wish to eat a lot don’t go there, but if you like to taste something totally different, please go...

If you want a three star experience for a one star pricetag, my advice is to go there for the lunch menu. During the three hours that we were there, we experienced nothing but gastronomic delight. Six amuses, five courses, a playful dessert, some herbal candy from their garden and the bill was more forgiving than in some mediocre Michelin star restaurants. 

They tried their very best to serve us in Dutch, even though the restaurant is in the French speaking part of the country. My advice would be to assign Dutchspeaking  waiters to specific tables, so that the information about the dishes is crystal clear. We felt silly because we didn't understand everything, but it's our fault for not speaking French. And again, they did their utmost best.

The view during lunch is very interesting as you can see how delicately the flowers and herbs are being handpicked for the next mise en place. And we were lucky to be next to the kitchen which allowed us a peek into the Chef's headquarters.

Of the five main dishes, only the quail with the eel and foix gras was slightly underwhelming and felt somewhat out of place. I guess one of the playful chocolate lollypops was far too sweet, but then again they are lollypops.

I'm sure the clients would appreciate it if the chef showed his face at the end of the experience, but I understand that he is probably preoccupied with making sure that every bite is as perfect as the next.

My new favourite restaurant.

Amazing location with a fabulous garden. The Plant Supremacy menu is insane. Every dish looks like a painting and the explosion of flavours is just unbelievable. One of the best food experiences ever.

We went there to celebrate our 30th anniversary with our children. 
We were welcomed and received a rond table near the large windows where we had a spectacular view on the garden and the country side. 
From beginning to end everything was just perfect; the appetisers all the dishes and then the dessert as apothéose was set on a special table cloth and covered all the table. It was exceptional. 
Also the wines were out off this world.
The service was also top. Very friendly and not to stiff. 
This restaurent has two Michelin stars now but in my view it deserves his third star in the very near future. 
Thanks again to all the staff of l'air du temps for this beautiful evening.

Close to Eghezee/Namur lays the beautiful farm where patron Sang-Hoon Degeimbre rules. The environment, where the crew grown their ingredients) is breath taking. With a group of eight chef's we had a dinner at the Chef's Table. 
6 'official' courses which are actually way over 10 accompanied by their selection of wines. Sang-Hoon took the time of explaining his ideas and how the dish was formed for every course. These dishes were fine dining pro forma. All was executed perfectly by the, ofcourse, highly trained staff. This place is heaven on earth, gastronomy at it's finest degree. The Michelin stars are well, well deserved. One of the best experiences in my lifetime.

Review Title: I wish I could give it a Six
Review Text:
Some experiences vastly surpass words. An evening at l’Air du temps is one of them.
From the beautiful scenery, magnificently understated modern interior - as if you are sitting in the garden, super-super friendly and relaxed service, to culinary discoveries that tell their own story dish after dish and the surprising line up of assorted wines. I can not find a single flaw in the whole experience. Probably the 2nd best restaurant I have ever been to (the best is Noma in Copenhagen).

unfortunately we did not get a table on the window as requested but the table in the middle of the room was not that busy as we first thought. during dinnertime the service got very friendly and welcoming and we enjoyed our anniversary dinner. san is most welcoming and the menu was great. beautiful location with great design and a fantastic view to the vast garden.

We went with a group of 7 people for an extraordinary journey !

Everything was perfect, suprising and served in a very relax atmosphere.

Many explanations received on the food, new roof, recording of birds songs... 

Certainly one of the top 3 restaurant in Belgium !

It might be seen as expensive but for the variety and the quality it's worth paying for suche experience!

Review Title: High priced but unique fine dining experience.
Review Text: Impossible to describe the meal. It was a complete dining experience based on natural homegrown products and a lot of research and creativity.

I am sure you enjoyed the artistic work delivered by the chef and the quality of the taste goes even way over the look!

There is not one single course not hitting the best mark, all was simply perfect, we had no comment whatsoever about the whole experience!

A quick word about the place itself, it is beautifully decorated, three main rooms and the building itself is gracious and outstanding.

Next time, no doubt, I will go for the water selection just to try it, we had a couple of spiced waters and woaw, discovery again, matching so well with the dishes…
they definitely have resources.
It is like their garden where they grow their own vegetables that you also can see in your plate…

One little thing though but I know they are working on it, not enough rooms available to sleep over… I booked the evening in October for mid-February and I had to go to a B&B nearby but as I had to drive, I only drank one glass of wine.

Completely worth the trip.
The tranquility of the rooms and garden, along with the uniqueness of the dinner were the highlight of our trip

Wow... what a surprise!
We went with 2 couples and were amazed by the level of this restaurant! Being a 2 star Michelin restaurant, the level is supposed to be high but all that is presented is surely at level! Location, superfriendly staff (although hardly any flemish speakers which is a bit of a pity), and amazing food! Delicious!

We went here because my husband wanted to eat here for already a long time. It was his birthday so I made reservations. Food was very tasty. We had the 7 course (I think it was 7) dinner. Started out with some delicious amuses. The main (pigeon) was seriously the best pigeon I ever ate. The garden view was also perfect. Only minor criticism I have is that when you come there, you go to the first room to have some snacks. And there is only the option to have some champagne or other sparkling wine as a aperitif. It would be -for me- also good to order a bottle of wine and already start there. We already had a few rounds of food before we got our first glass of wine.

Review Title: One of a kind experience that cannot be forgotten
Review Text:
We visited the property on July 13. 
We opted for the package which included a tasting dinner and overnight stay. 
It was AMAZING. 
Everything: the property. The hotel. The restaurant. The service. The quality. 
Chef San Degeimbre goes literally out of his way to make you feel at home while away from home. He personally greets you upon arrival, comes visit several times during dinner and leads the way out once the meal is complete. 
Every dish served is a artwork. A triumph of tastes and colors. Everything that grows in the adjacent garden is used. 
It was an unforgettable experience which I consider fortunate enough to have lived. 
Highly recommended. 
Thank you!!

We’ve been quite a few times to the restaurant and I’m still impressed by the always increasing experience each time we go. San is a stellar chief, his usage of his garden products is just amazing, the tastes are incredibly subtle. Everything in the plate is perfect.

Quite surprised not to get an answer to my request whether a vegetarian alternative can be served to the menu (fish no meat)? Never had problems with that question on other restaurants (Michelin star or not) so far, but it’s been over a week since I asked.

Was actually very much looking forward to book a weekend stay with you. Your B&B and restaurant look amazing.

i have been there 4 times.

in the new location first time ...

fanttastic place and very nice experience...
the korean cheaf is very bravo
.see yuo soon..

saluti carmine

One of the best culinary experiences ever.
This place offers excellent service, lovely sitting and very surprising and amazing combination of tastes.
I heard their b&b being also fantastic but didn’t had a pleasure staying there.
Highly recommended!!!
